intro: Schradera capitata, commonly known as the clustered schradera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often covered in fine hairs. Schradera capitata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
